channel.title: Grandprix.com News Feed
channel.author: Grandprix.ocm
channel.description: The source for Grand Prix news

item.title: Wolff curious to see Ocon's next steps in F1
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff says he is "curious" to observe the next developments in Esteban Ocon's Formula 1 career.

item.title: No young driver test for Sainz or Vettel
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Current Formula 1 drivers have been told by the FIA that they are not eligible to do the 'young driver test' in Abu Dhabi after this weekend's 2020 finale.

item.title: Russians defend Mazepin amid groping scandal
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: A prominent Russian motor racing official has defended 2021 Haas rookie Nikita Mazepin amid a scandal accusing the 21-year-old driver of 'groping' a friend.

item.title: Hamilton on right track for Abu Dhabi return says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff says Mercedes' star driver is "on the right track" for returning to the cockpit this weekend in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Hamilton holds 2021 teammate trump card
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lewis Hamilton holds "a trump card" when it comes to the identity of his teammate for 2021.

item.title: Quitting F1 would have been easy for Renault says Prost
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Renault over-performed in 2020, according to team advisor and F1 legend Alain Prost.

item.title: F1 commentator doubts Russell conspiracy theory
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: A Formula 1 commentator has hit back at conspiracy theories surrounding Mercedes' bungled pitstops that cost George Russell victory last weekend in Bahrain.

item.title: Mazepin mistakes must not occur in F1 says Steiner
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Nikita Mazepin "must not" carry over to his F1 debut next year some of the "mistakes" he has been making in Formula 2.

item.title: Wolff hints at 2021 race seat for Russell
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff is no longer ruling out a sensational driver lineup change for Mercedes in 2021.

item.title: Russell costs 50 million less than Hamilton
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: While George Russell's Sakhir GP performance has put Valtteri Bottas under immense pressure, it is also an uncomfortable moment for Lewis Hamilton.

item.title: Verstappen hits back at Leclerc criticism
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen has hit back at Charles Leclerc in the wake of last Sunday's Sakhir GP.

item.title: F1 drivers too clinical with media says Ebel
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Retiring Formula 1 personality Kai Ebel says the sport's stars, and even the celebrities at the grands prix, have become "too clinical" when speaking to the media.

item.title: Ferrari's Resta to Haas because of budget cap says Binotto
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mattia Binotto has admitted that designer Simone Resta's move to Haas is connected with the budget cap rules that come into force next year.

item.title: Russell form a wake-up call for Red Bull
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The availability of on-form drivers like George Russell and Sergio Perez is "a wake-up call" for Red Bull.

item.title: Ferrari always looking towards next year
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Flavio Briatore has rolled his eyes at the suggestion that Ferrari may get back on the pace of F1's frontrunners next year.

item.title: Two countries must green-light Hamilton's return
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Whether Lewis Hamilton can return to his Mercedes cockpit for the 2020 finale this weekend is up to health officials in Bahrain and Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Mick's uncle Ralf slams Michael Schumacher comparisons
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ralf Schumacher has slammed the "constant comparisons" that are made between his brother Michael and the career of the seven time world champion's son Mick.

item.title: Race Analysis - To the Point
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sakhir GP - Race Analysis

item.title: Former Red Bull driver urges Marko to sign Perez
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The team that is ousting Sakhir GP winner Sergio Perez says the Mexican "deserves a place in Formula 1".

item.title: Grosjean skipping Abu Dhabi to avoid skin graft
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean says skipping the final race in his Formula 1 career this weekend will safeguard his longer-term health.

item.title: Replacing Bottas with Russell not realistic says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff has played down suggestions that Mercedes might be on the cusp of a sensational driver lineup change for 2021.

item.title: Bottas' shares have collapsed after Sakhir GP
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Valtteri Bottas put himself under a spotlight in Sunday's Sakhir GP - for the wrong reasons.

item.title: Ferrari pushing for Abu Dhabi young driver test for Sainz
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari is trying to green light a test in Ferrari's 2020 car for Carlos Sainz.

item.title: Race Notes - Perez wins Sakhir Grand Prix
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sakhir GP - Race Notes

item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sakhir GP - Race Results

item.title: Russell boosts market value in Hamilton's car
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: George Russell has upped his market value "enormously" with his performance at the wheel of the ill Lewis Hamilton's Mercedes in Bahrain.

item.title: Magnussen defends Grosjean stand-in Fittipaldi
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Kevin Magnussen has defended his regular teammate Romain Grosjean's replacement driver in Bahrain.

item.title: Now Vettel wants Racing Point test in Abu Dhabi
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Fernando Alonso on Saturday smiled when told that some of Renault's rival teams are unhappy about his participation in the forthcoming 'young driver test' in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Perez just said hello to Red Bull's Marko in Bahrain
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sergio Perez on Saturday played down the significance of being spotted in conversation with Red Bull's Dr Helmut Marko in the Bahrain paddock.

item.title: Kvyat has accepted 2021 fate
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Daniil Kvyat says he has "accepted" the likelihood that he will be left without a Formula 1 seat for 2021.

item.title: Vettel took a long time to accept Ferrari axe
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel has admitted it took him "a long time" to accept Ferrari's decision to oust him for 2021.

item.title: Qualifying Report - A narrow margin
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sakhir GP - Qualifying Report

item.description: Sakhir GP - Practice 3 Results

item.title: Russell can win immediately says Verstappen
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen thinks George Russell can "win immediately" this weekend and put big pressure on Mercedes' regular driver Valtteri Bottas.

item.title: Renault progress surprised Ricciardo in 2020
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Daniel Ricciardo is putting a brave face on his looming move from an ever-stronger Renault team to McLaren for 2021.

item.title: Albon could spend year on the bench says Horner
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Alex Albon will either be retained by Red Bull or he will spend "a year on the bench" in 2021.

item.title: Ferrari designer Resta to have senior Haas role
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari designer Simone Resta will take up a "very senior position" at Haas.

item.title: Grosjean supports TV replays of horror crash
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean says he is "not against" Formula 1 deciding to show all the replays of his horror crash of last Sunday.

item.title: Vettel hits out at young driver test theatre
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel has hit out at the "typical theatre" surrounding the forthcoming post-Abu Dhabi test.

item.title: F1 chose short track for entertainment says Verstappen
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen has accused Formula 1 of chasing mere entertainment value by running this weekend's race in Bahrain on the short 'outer' perimeter layout.

item.title: No doctor clearance for Grosjean yet
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean still isn't sure if he will be able to round out his Formula 1 career next weekend in Abu Dhabi - and therefore has a 'plan B' up his sleeve.

item.title: Mazepin not offended by pay-driver jibe
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Nikita Mazepin insists he is "not offended" that he is often regarded as just another pay-driver in Formula 1.

item.title: Two manufacturers quit Formula E
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Two manufacturers are pulling out of Formula E.

item.title: Friday Report - Russell times two
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sakhir GP - Friday Report

item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sakhir GP - Friday Photos

item.title: Practice 1 Results
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sakhir GP - Practice 1 Results

item.title: Defeat to Russell wouldn't look good says Bottas
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Valtteri Bottas has acknowledged the pressure on him in Bahrain, admitting it is "an important weekend" for his status and future in Formula 1.

item.title: Steiner hits back at angry Haas reserve
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner has hit back at Haas reserve driver Louis Deletraz, who is upset that he was overlooked to replace Romain Grosjean this weekend in Bahrain.

item.title: Magnussen not ruling out Indycar future
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Kevin Magnussen is not ruling out using 2021 as a springboard into America's top open wheeler category Indycar.

item.title: Sainz hopes to test 2020 Ferrari in Abu Dhabi
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Carlos Sainz is hoping to join his countryman Fernando Alonso in being allowed to take part in the so-called 'young drivers test' in the days after next weekend's Abu Dhabi finale.

item.title: Ferrari junior Ilott set for 2021 sabbatical
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Callum Ilott says he may have to take a sabbatical in 2020.

item.title: Haas not worried about Mazepin's super licence
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Haas boss Gunther Steiner says he is not worried that he has signed up a driver for 2021 who does not currently have a Formula 1 super licence.

item.title: Schumacher could replace Grosjean in Abu Dhabi
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mick Schumacher could make his Formula 1 debut earlier than expected.

item.title: Newey to Aston Martin rumours resurface
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: New reports suggest Aston Martin is making a big-money bid to lure famous F1 designer Adrian Newey from Red Bull.

item.title: Grosjean could have year off after crash
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean has all but admitted he was to blame for his fiery crash in Bahrain last Sunday.

item.title: Verstappen covid-negative after Hamilton contact
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen has tested negative for covid-19 following concerns he was a 'close contact' of world champion Lewis Hamilton's last week.

item.title: How good is Mercedes without Hamilton?
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bahrain this weekend will show whether Lewis Hamilton is "worth every penny" to Mercedes.

item.title: Ferrari made call to promote Schumacher to Haas
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari chose which one of its three 'academy' junior drivers would race for Haas in 2021, according to the American outfit's boss Gunther Steiner.

item.title: Alonso shown green light for young driver test
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Fernando Alonso has been shown the green light to test Renault's 2020 car in the 'young driver' test after Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Steiner better than Vasseur as Mick's first boss says Ralf
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner is the perfect first team boss for Mick Schumacher.

item.title: George Russell to sub at Mercedes
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: With the announcment that Lewis Hamilton will sit out this weekend's Grand Prix due to his positive covid-19 test result, Mercedes GP has drafted in George Russell to drive alongside Valtteri Bottas at the Sakhir Grand Prix.

item.title: Reserve Jack Aitken in at Williams
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: With George Russell off to Constructors' Champion Mercedes GP this weekend to substitute for convalescing Lewis Hamilton, Williams has announed that Formula 2 driver Jack Aitken will drive for the Williams-Mercedes team this weekend.

item.title: Mick Schumacher to drive for Haas in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The Haas F1 team has confirmed a long running rumor that Mick Schumacher will join the team for the 2021 season. Schumacher is the current Formula 2 championship leader with the final round being run this weekend at Sakhir.

item.title: No green light for Grosjean's return yet says Steiner
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean says he wants to return to action for his final Formula 1 race in Abu Dhabi next weekend "after a bit of psychological work".

item.title: French GP crowd capped at 15,000 for 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: French GP organisers have been granted approval for a crowd size of just 15,000 spectators for the race at Paul Ricard next June.

item.title: Champions slam Ricciardo over F1 replay criticism
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Two former world champions have slammed Daniel Ricciardo for his stinging rebuke of the way Formula 1 handled the replays of Romain Grosjean's fiery crash.

item.title: Ferrari wants leniency as budget cap looms
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari is pushing for leniency as the budget cap looms for 2021.

item.title: Haas admits Mazepin's father could sponsor team
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner has defended his decision to sign Nikita Mazepin for 2021 and beyond - and denied that the Russian's father Dmitry is buying the small American team.

item.title: Boss says Grosjean replacement Fittipaldi not a mascot
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner has hit back at critics of Haas' decision to replace the injured Romain Grosjean with Pietro Fittipaldi this weekend in Bahrain.

item.title: VW to quit motor racing completely
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Volkswagen is quitting motor racing - completely.

item.title: Hamilton tests positive for covid-19
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The Mercedes GP team announced on tuesday that after taking the Bahrain Grand Prix on Sunday, that the seven-time World Champion woke up on Monday morning suffering mild syptoms and subsequently tested posititve for covid-19. Hamilton was tested again a also tested positive.

item.title: Journalist says Grosjean aims to race in Abu Dhabi
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean is reportedly aiming to return to the cockpit of his Haas car in Abu Dhabi, for what will almost certainly be his last Formula 1 race.

item.title: Drivers not sissies after big crashes says Verstappen
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen has hit back at criticism of his claim that Formula 1 drivers should not have the choice to sit out a race after a horror crash involving one of their rivals.

item.title: Perez unsure if Verstappen blocking Red Bull seat
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sergio Perez says he will only found out "after the end of the season" if Red Bull will rescue his Formula 1 career by signing him up for 2021.

item.title: F1 defends decision to show Grosjean crash replays
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Formula 1 has hit back at criticism of the way the sport handled the television replays of Romain Grosjean's horror crash in Bahrain last Sunday.

item.title: No F1 debut for Callum Ilott in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Callum Ilott has counted himself out of the running for a Formula 1 debut in 2021.

item.title: No doubt that F1 dodged a fatality says Salo
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mika Salo says a simple driver miscalculation caused Romain Grosjean's horror and fiery crash in Bahrain last Sunday.

item.title: Race Analysis - Miraclous
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bahrain GP - Race Analysis

item.title: Pietro Fittipaldi to replace Grosjean in Sakhir
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Brazilian Pietro Fittipaldi will make his Formula 1 debut this weekend at the Sakhir Grand Prix, replacing the ailing Romain Grosjean.

item.title: Albon podium performance not very good says Verstappen
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen has poured cold water on his struggling teammate Alex Albon's podium celebrations in Bahrain.

item.title: Halo 'absolutely' saved Grosjean's life
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean on Sunday miraculously survived one of the scariest crashes in Formula 1 history.

item.title: Sainz test would be in last year's Ferrari says Gene
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari is apparently making plans to prepare a 2019-spec car for Carlos Sainz to test early next year.

item.title: Wolff backs TV replays of horror Grosjean crash
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff has backed Formula 1's decision to broadcast multiple replays of the horrifying Romain Grosjean crash on Sunday.

item.title: Haas wants Grosjean to race this weekend
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The Haas team's 'plan A' is for Romain Grosjean to return to action this weekend in Bahrain.

item.title: Race Notes - Hamilton wins Bahrain GP
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bahrain GP - Race Notes

item.title: Pirelli pushing ahead with criticised 2021 tyres
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mario Isola has bad news for Formula 1 drivers - the proposed 2021 tyres are still on track to make their debut next year.

item.title: Kvyat unsure he will be offered reserve role
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Daniil Kvyat says he isn't even sure if he will be offered the role of Red Bull's official reserve driver for 2021.

item.title: Binotto to re-join Ferrari team next week
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mattia Binotto says he will be back in the Formula 1 paddock next week.

item.title: Perez tipped to announce sabbatical on Monday
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Big rumours are swirling in the Bahrain paddock about Sergio Perez's future.

item.title: Red Bull engine program looks good for 2022
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Red Bull can afford to operate its own engine program in 2022, according to Dr Helmut Marko.

item.title: Vettel much more positive as Ferrari tenure ends
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel says he is feeling "much more positive" as his six-year tenure with Ferrari comes to its end.

item.title: Red Bull engine plan heading for compromise
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari and even Renault appear to be moving towards a compromise solution that would allow Red Bull to run its own Honda engines in 2022 and beyond.

item.title: Hulkenberg hot for chance at 2021 Red Bull seat
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Nico Hulkenberg has admitted he is "extremely hot" at the prospect of landing a plum Red Bull seat for his full-time return to Formula 1 in 2021.

item.title: F1 drivers slam Pirelli's proposed 2021 tyre
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Top Formula 1 drivers have slammed Pirelli's proposed new tyres for 2021.

item.title: Schumacher wanted Raikkonen as first F1 teammate
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mick Schumacher has hinted at disappointment that he will not make his Formula 1 debut next year at Alfa Romeo.

item.title: Kubica admits people think I'm not fast
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Robert Kubica says he is no longer on the Formula 1 grid "because people think I'm not fast".

item.title: Pirelli boss tips Hamilton to keep dominating
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mario Isola is tipping Mercedes to keep on dominating in 2021.

item.title: Hamilton will eventually sign contract says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff says Lewis Hamilton has "assured" him that he will eventually sign a new contract.

item.title: Sainz eyes test in 2018-spec Ferrari
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Carlos Sainz is already thinking about his forthcoming preparations to switch to Ferrari over the winter.

item.title: New deadline for Red Bull's 2022 Honda plan
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Dr Helmut Marko has set a new deadline as Red Bull makes its engine plans for 2022.

item.title: Practice 1 Results
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bahrain GP - Practice 1 Results

item.title: Abiteboul not responding to messages says Alonso
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Fernando Alonso has joked that 2021 team boss Cyril Abiteboul is already "getting tired" of him.

item.title: Haas to announce Schumacher deal soon
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Haas will announce its new drivers for 2021 "soon", according to team boss Gunther Steiner.

item.title: New job and fatherhood for Magnussen in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Kevin Magnussen looks set to begin his post-Formula 1 life by becoming a father.

item.title: Spa GP records smaller loss amid pandemic
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The corona crisis actually helped Spa-Francorchamps to minimise its losses in 2020.

item.title: Fingers crossed for Schumacher's debut says Brawn
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ross Brawn says he will be keeping his "fingers crossed" for Mick Schumacher's highly anticipated Formula 1 debut next year.

item.title: Kubica not sure he will remain F1 reserve
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Robert Kubica says he is yet to decide if he will remain Alfa Romeo's official F1 reserve driver in 2021.

item.title: Money to decide 23rd race host in 2021 says Brawn
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ross Brawn has named three leading contenders to complete Formula 1's planned 23-race calendar in 2021.

item.title: Ross Brawn says Ferrari must prioritise 2022
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari "must" prioritise preparations for the 2022 season, the Maranello team's former highly-successful technical boss Ross Brawn insists.

item.title: F1 to keep two-day race format in our pocket says Brawn
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ross Brawn says Formula 1 will "keep in our pockets" the controversial two-day race weekend format.

item.title: Saudi Arabia defends F1 race amid criticism
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Saudi Arabia's motor racing chief has defended the addition of the Arab Kingdom to the 2021 Formula 1 calendar.

item.title: Hamilton better than Schumacher says Barrichello
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lewis Hamilton is "better than Michael Schumacher", according to the latter seven time world champion's former Ferrari teammate.

item.title: Vettel wouldn't say no to Mercedes
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel has admitted he "wouldn't say no" to an offer to switch to Mercedes.

item.title: Binotto to also sit out Bahrain GP
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mattia Binotto has confirmed that he will sit out a second consecutive race this weekend.

item.title: Marko comments after Vettel named best of generation
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mercedes' utter dominance since 2014 explains why many Formula 1 fans do not regard Lewis Hamilton as the best driver of his generation.

item.title: F1 comeback chances not very real says Sirotkin
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sergey Sirotkin has admitted his chances of returning to the Formula 1 grid are "not very real".

item.title: Hamilton hits back at lucky champion jibe
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lewis Hamilton has hit back at the idea that he is simply "lucky" to have benefitted from Mercedes' utter dominance in past seasons.

item.title: Raikkonen still one of F1's best says Giovinazzi
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Kimi Raikkonen remains one of the very best drivers in Formula 1.

item.title: Engine not Ferrari's only big problem says Vettel
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel says there is more to Ferrari's problems than simply an underperforming engine.

item.title: Schumacher took one or two tips from father
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mick Schumacher says he has used "one or two tips" from his famous father throughout his rise to Formula 1.

item.title: Questions about Ferrari regret annoying says Sainz
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Carlos Sainz says being asked if he regrets his 2021 move to Ferrari is now becoming "annoying".

item.title: Monza wants funds to restore banking for racing
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Monza is seeking government backing in the hope of restoring the old banked sections of the historic Autodromo "for racing".

item.title: Alonso may not succeed in F1 comeback says Massa
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Fernando Alonso's return to Formula 1 could be as unsuccessful as that of his former championship rival and F1 legend Michael Schumacher.

item.title: 2022 cars may be 1 second slower than now says Key
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The new-generation cars of 2022 may only be a single second slower than the unprecedentedly-fast single seaters of this year.

item.title: Perez-Indycar stories doing the rounds
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Three current Formula 1 drivers could be joining two other F1 refugees in the top American single seater category Indycar next year.
